venue.name: Microsoft New England Research and Development Center

item.description:
Hi Everyone,

We know this is last minute, but we have secured 2 rooms for future WordPress Meetups. Based on the results of the polls, the majority would like to see 2 tracks (Toolbox [non-coding] and Dev/Design [coding]) with 1 topic for each track. And with Microsoft's help, they have agreed to support our expansion.

As a result, we are bringing you 2 topics for this month (one for each track).

Toolbox: "Growing up from WordPress.com to Wordpress.org" by myself (Kurt). Here, we will go though a brand new installation on a new host (we'll cover 2 hosts), setting up, getting plugins in order and finding a starter base theme.

Dev/Design: "Cool Stuff Developers Can Do With WordPress" by Brian Krausz. Here, Brian will go through WordPress hooks as well as some of the architecture behind WordPress plugins. Some knowledge of PHP is recommended.

Agenda:
7-7:30pm Networking, Pizza
7:30-7:45pm Opening remarks, updates, any other business
7:50-8:50pm Sessions (rooms TBD)
8:50-9pm Wrap-up

Page.ly has been generous and will be sponsoring this month's event. More details will be given out that night.

Don't forget our new website, Twitter account and Facebook page.
item.name: BWPM May 2010: The Beginning of the 2 Track Meetup
